tags: congrats anon your the first to ask about that lol
summary: do u have D&D characters? tell us about them if you do :)
question: do u have D&D characters? tell us about them if you do :)
answer:
Ok everybody, it’s time for me to make the ultimate confession. The true doozy, the one that nobody saw coming…

I have only ever played 1 D&D Campaign in my entire life, it was at a very popular Brooklyn tabletop store called the Brooklyn Strategist. My character was Seraphina Goodbarrel, a halfling bard. It only lasted 3 months on a weekly basis. We all got too busy to keep going and the loud crowdedness of the location left me too overwhelmed to enjoy it sometimes.

I only ever DM’d one game in my life, and that was after begging my parents and cousins to be my guinea pigs because I never did it before. It was the TAZ Balance Return to the Test of Initiation one shot. It was mostly fun, and I realized maybe I could do it in the future if it were one-shots or not too complex. Still, I am overwhelmed by the concept

I know a LOT about D&D, I adore Critical Role to death, but I have barely ever played. I have barely ever played ANY tabletop RPG. This is because I have barely any friends, and the ones I do have either don’t care or are genuinely too busy for us to try a game. I also have no initiative to go outside and get a life. I also am not interested in online play

So basically, I could be called a fake D&D nerd, because I have little to no experience.

summary: PATRICK ROTHFUSS: (offscreen) Keyleth, I write to let you and your companions know that the repair of Westruun is proceeding...
body:
PATRICK ROTHFUSS: (offscreen) Keyleth, I write to let you and your companions know that the repair of Westruun is proceeding well. I will not bore you with the details. Suffice to say that our children are well-fed and safe, our elderly and infirm are cared for and comfortable. Without the help of you and yours, this would not be the case.

The folk in charge argue constantly, but that is to be expected, and it is no bad thing. They all want the same good things in different ways. I listen, mostly, and do what I can to make sure that they listen to each other. Without listening,nothing good can happen.

The town– when I say the repair is going well, it is a hard thing for me to talk about. I am not a particularly clever man, and much of this is new to me. When you make a mistake with metal, you can melt things down and start afresh. It is irritating, and it costs in time and soot and sweat, but it can be done. There is a comfort in iron, knowing that a fresh start is always possible. But a city is not a sword. It is a living thing, and living things defy simple fixing. Roots cannot be reforged. They scar, and broken branches must be cut and sealed with tar, and this makes me angry, as it always has, and my anger has no place to go.

It was easier when I was young. I could use my anger like a hammer against the world. I was so sure of myself and my friends and my rightness. I would hammer at the world, and breaking felt like making to me, and I was good at it. And while I was not wrong, neither was I entirely right.

Nothing is simple. I do not work in wood. I am not brave enough for that. There is a comfort in iron, a promise of safety, a second chance if mistakes

are made. But a city is more a forest than a sword. No, it needs more tending than that.Perhaps a city is like a garden, then.

So these days, it seems I have become a gardener. I dig foundations in the earth. I sow rows of houses. I plan and plant. I watch the skies for rain and ruin. I cannot help but think that you would be better at this, but circumstance has put both of us in our own odd place. You are forced to be a hammer in the world, and my ungentle hands are learning how to tend a plot of land.

We must do what we can do.

Did you know that there are some seeds that cannot sprout unless they are first burned? A friend once told me that. She was– she was a bookish sort. I think of gardening constantly these days. I wear your gift, and I think of you, and I think it is interesting that there are some living things that need to pass through fire before they flourish.

I ramble. You have the heart of a gardener, and because of this, you think of consequence, and your current path pains you. I am not wise, and I do not give advice, but I have come to know a few things: sometimes breaking is making, even iron can start again, and there are many things that move through fire and find themselves much better for it afterward.

I have enclosed a gift. Once it was a sword, but it has changed. It is a small thing, and silly.Please forgive an old man for his foolishness. Still, I hope it brings you some small comfort.

Kindly, Kerr.

(Enclosed is a ring of iron with branches engraved with the words “I have passed through fire”)

blog.name: critical-limey
blog.title: DnD Shenanigans up the Wazoo
blog.description: DnD artist-in-training // knee-deep in Critical Role // will feature PCs from other games // LimeyBlueArt on Twitter, savannahfennick on Twitch

blog.name: fisherrend
blog.title: DnD Creations
blog.description: Self-taught creative mind from Sweden. There is nothing I love more than to draw, write and make shit up. Here you will find maps, characters, races, monsters, original characters, fan characters and other bits and pieces made, drawn or written by me. All homebrew content is available for public use; just don't claim it as your own. Please do share though if you use anything I've made, I'd love to showcase your creations!

tags: or should we maybe call her
summary: At any cost (?) Critical Role Campaign 2 Episode 55.  Such a wild episode, and I felt like it was the first time I had true...
caption:
At any cost (?)

Critical Role Campaign 2 Episode 55.

Such a wild episode, and I felt like it was the first time I had true inspiration to draw a proper fanart piece for my favorite show. I can’t wait to see the aftermath. 

This took me two whole days. I have literally spent the entirety of today doing nothing but lineart, coloring and effects. Lots of experiments in here, lots of things I’ve never done before, but I’m happy with the end result!

blog.name: roleingthrough
blog.title: Critical Role Live Listen
blog.description: I've broken down and decided to start listening to Critical Role. However, with so much content I need something to motivate me, and I feel like liveblogging the experience is as good an option as any. THIS IS A NO SPOILERS ZONE FOR ME but like, presumably there will be spoilers at some point.

body:
Episode 2: Into Greyspire Mines

-Ive only had Demetrius for a day and a half but if anything happened to him I would kill all of Vox Machina and then myself

-Keyleth sweetie you’re doing amazing

-its serious whiplash coming from TAZ to this and actually hearing them buy stuff like health potions and arrows. The Fantasy Costco was more for special magical items than maintenance stuff. The negotiations were funny though

-Vex immediately getting confused by the beast gave me flashbacks to my first campaign. I love how natural her and Vax’s dynamic feels

-Proud to announce Percy De Rolo is still a very good boy

-Grog dropping down to 0 intelligence is a mid semester mood

-Ive only had Demetrius for a day and a half but if anything happened to him I would kill all of Vox Machina and then myself

-Keyleth sweetie you’re doing amazing

-its serious whiplash coming from TAZ to this and actually hearing them buy stuff like health potions and arrows. The Fantasy Costco was more for special magical items than maintenance stuff. The negotiations were funny though

-Vex immediately getting confused by the beast gave me flashbacks to my first campaign. I love how natural her and Vax’s dynamic feels

-Proud to announce Percy De Rolo is still a very good boy

-Grog dropping down to 0 intelligence is a mid semester mood

blog.name: jugglingdice
blog.title: Some people juggle dice!
blog.description:
Queer, ace, learning how to draw.

D&D and Critical Role blog. Spoilers tagged cr spoilers until Monday. Up to date on both campaigns! They/them.

summary: Ok so where’s the meta on why Caleb responded so intensely to seeing Jester chop up the quasits and most especially the part...
body:
Ok so where’s the meta on why Caleb responded so intensely to seeing Jester chop up the quasits and most especially the part where he said ‘this is very familiar to me’

Bc unless I’m completely forgetting some obvious in-game reference this is clearly more Trent Ickythot malarkey and proof (as if we needed it) that Liam is absolutely not done breaking our hearts

blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol
blog.description:
Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

summary: I've known Pike for exactly 1 hour 20 minutes and 41 seconds and if anything were to happen to her I would kill everyone else...
body:
I’ve known Pike for exactly 1 hour 20 minutes and 41 seconds and if anything were to happen to her I would kill everyone else and then myself.

(binge watching briarwood arc for the first time because of the Kickstarter)
